title: [Large-Scale] Indonesian Speaking Education Course Based on Cultural Values

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Indonesian vocabulary and grammar knowledge
context.additional_context: Focused on cultivating practical speaking skills integrated with Indonesian local culture for 20-something beginner learners affiliated with vocational training institutions. Learning outcomes are measured through project-based assessment, operating in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Demonstrate daily conversational scenarios reflecting Indonesian cultural values (collaboration, respect for diversity, tolerance, and etiquette) with over 80% accuracy.
Achieve a score of 4 or higher on a 5-point scale in role-playing activities that consider cultural context.
Develop a 5-minute presentation explaining Indonesian traditional etiquette and social customs to pass project evaluation.

Learners can analyze 3 conflict cases in multicultural team projects (≥4 members) and draft consensus statements by applying ≥2 of the given conflict resolution strategies (improved communication, role redistribution, compromise proposals).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
